intro: Espeletia jabonensis, commonly known as the Jabonero, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its rosette growth form. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in its arid environment. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in a compact inflorescence at the center of the plant. Espeletia jabonensis is well adapted to rocky soils and is often found in páramo ecosystems.
